title: Analog I/O
description: In modern digital electronics, we often deal with finite states of HIGH or LOW, which represent digital 1/0, or On/Off, respectively. However, there are many sensors or other integrations that communicate not in binary, but in a range of voltages. For instance, a TMP35 analog temp sensor might output 0V when it's reading an ambient temperature of 0ºC, 1.6V @ 50ºC, and 3.3V @ 100ºC.

frontMatter.title: Analog I/O
frontMatter.subtitle: Reading and writing non-binary voltages via the Analog-to-Digital Converter (ADC), and Digital-to-Analog Converter (DAC).
